intro: Cudrania cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese cudrania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, though they may change color depending on the variety. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
